newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss sight deposits fall to 3,393.7 million Sfr.
newsitem.headline: Swiss sight deposits fall to 3,393.7 million Sfr.

text.p: The Swiss National Bank said sight deposits fell by 152.1 million Swiss francs to 3.39 billion in the reporting period ended March 20.
Statement of March 20 in millions of Swiss francs:

Borrowing at the emergency Lombard window rose by 9.6 million francs to 12.2 million in the reporting period. Outstanding borrowing via the discount facility and swaps of money market certificates fell by 1,066.8 million francs to 1,464.6 million.
An SNB spokesman said the change in sight deposits was within the range of normal fluctuations. "There was nothing unusual," the spokesman told Reuters.
